intro: Mulgedium lessertianum subsp. lyratum, commonly known as the lyratum bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from blue to purple. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes other bellflowers. The subspecies lyratum is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and habitat preferences.
